meanings.definition: A structure built to support the lateral pressure of an arch or span.
meanings.sent1: The abutments of the bridge held up the weight of the road above.
meanings.sent2: The engineer inspected the abutments to ensure they were strong enough.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the abutments of the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the abutments that supported her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The ancient stones formed the abutments of the majestic castle.

meanings.definition: The point at which two things are joined together.
meanings.sent1: The abutments of the puzzle pieces fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent2: The abutments of the train tracks connected seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The abutments of the conversation led to a surprising revelation.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the abutments that linked their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The abutments of the zipper were stuck, making it hard to open.
